main.name: Jorge Ochoa-Reyes
main.bio: I enjoy programming and am excited to always learn new technologies! I am currently learning VR development in Unity with C# and hope to create a personal project using React, Graphql, URQL, Postgreql, Redis, and Nodejs.
main.contactmessage: Best way to contact me would be email!, I check it daily, otherwise phone works as well.

education.description: Computer Sciene Club Officer, and Google Developers Club Vice President

work.description: A virtual reality project where I created and tested 3 different virtual reality keyboard layouts with 4 different control modalities (head pointer, hand pointer, touch control, and dwell time head pointer)
A words per minute game with words being based on different languages, such as jsx, js, python, and c++. Scores can be entered upon completion of the minute typing phase.
Android app for the popular MOBA Dota 2 game, which allows you to review the attributes and lore of all 121 heroes, along with the items included in the game.
Official website for the CSU Fresno Computer Science Club. Contains events information, projects created by the club, and information on the currecnt officers.

research.title: Evaluation of a Tree-based Menu Virtual Keyboard in Fully Immersive Virtual Reality
research.abstract: Results: There exist a significant difference between the two virtual keyboards (VK1: standard qwerty layout, VK2: tree-based menu layout), with VK1 taking less time per command ratio than VK2, but found no significant difference between the keyboards regarding workload and usability.
